author: Heather Haddon
title: Mexico’s Grupo Comercial Chedraui Agrees to Buy Texas Grocer Fiesta Mart
text:
The U.S. arm of Mexico’s Grupo Comercial Chedraui SA agreed to buy Texas-based Fiesta Mart Inc., the latest supermarket tie-up as a wave of consolidation shifts into Hispanic food stores.

The acquisition, by Chedraui’s California-based unit Bodega Latina Corp., which runs the El Super chain, values closely held Fiesta Mart at as much as $300 million including debt, according to people with knowledge of the discussions.
